article.headline: Texas A&M-Corpus Christi 91, Texas-Arlington 72
article.story: CORPUS CHRISTI, Texas (AP) -- Josh Washington hit a school-record eight 3-pointers on his way to a career-high 28 points as Texas A&M-Corpus Christi beat Texas-Arlington 91-72 on Monday night. Texas-Arlington led early but Texas A&M-Corpus Christi (20-5, 11-1 Southland) went on a 12-4 run capped by a Washington 3-pointer to seize the lead for good six minutes into the game. The Islanders led 42-37 at halftime. Washington went 8-of-12 from the field, including 8-of-11 from behind the arc. Seth Engelken and Cedric Smith came off the bench to add 19 points and 10 points, respectively. Rodrick Epps led the Mavericks (11-15, 6-7) with 17 points, including 10-for-10 free-throw shooting. Larry Posey came off the bench to add 12 points and lead the team with seven rebounds. Texas-Arlington outrebounded the Islanders 36-33. The Mavericks were hampered by poor second-half shooting, hitting only 29 percent from the field. The Islanders shot 84 percent from the free-throw line for the game. The Mavericks shot 38 percent from the field for the game to the Islanders' 52 percent.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
